column4: i tried manually configuring the grub menu.lst but nothign works
i did the usual hda (0,1) etc and added it probably and nothing
grub displays the windows xp pro list that i created but when i enter windows it says an error on screen
like it doenst know the parameters or whatever
juano explain to me more
i know
i did that
but i still get error
i put (0,1)
and nothing
Pastebin fdisk -l and /etc/fstab
Try hd(1,0) instead of hd(0,0). The drive order is backwards on your computer between grub and ubuntu.
juano__ : I don't think you can do both, can you?
Remove the map lines and replace hd1,0 with hd0,0
Or the other way around, I'm confused.
No its not.
You changed your ubuntu drive from 0 to 1. Change it back.
Otherwise you won't be able to boot anything.
Originally you had ubuntu as 0,0. Why did you change it?
juano__ : Here: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/45589/
That's what you had at first.
Windows should be 1,0. Ubuntu should be 0,0.
You didn't change anything?
You're good.
